bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wickliffe Rose, December 29, 1921

div1.p: Carter requests that Rose proofread his Spanish translation of an article sent to him by Hanson.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wickliffe Rose, December 29, 1921
div1.opener:
Hanson
Rose
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.,
December 29, 1921.
Dr. Wickliffe Rose, General Director,
International Health Board,
61 Broadway, New York, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Rose:
div1.p:
I am enclosing to you a translation of an article sent me by
Hanson for correction of the Spanish. The excerpt below from his let-
ter transmitting it will explain why I do so. I judge that he wants
this published for distribution in Peru, but he does not directly say
so. If so, whether he wants this done here by the International Health
Board or in Peru, I do not know. Possibly you do. If not to be pub-
lished here, please forward the corrected translation to him.
I am very sorry to hear of Dr. Case's death.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, H. R. Carter Excerpt
(from Dr. Hanson's letter)
"Chiclayo, Peru.
December 6, 1921.
“We have completed the translation and the copying of your arti-
cle on the Spontaneous Elimination of Yellow Fever from Endemic Cen-
ters. Enclosed you will find a copy and presume that you will revise
and notify either me or Dr. Rose about any errors which may be found.
I have sent one copy to Dr. White and one to Dr. Rose. I am also
sending a copy to the Salubridad. I have previously sent them copy

of the translation made by Rivere of the two lectures which you de-
livered before the U. S. P. H. S., and Dr. Eyzaguire, the Statisti-
cian, told me that they were going to have these lectures reproduced.”
